results.title: Hoodwink [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claude Whatham, Errol Sullivan, Pom Oliver, New South Wales Film Corporation and CB Films (France)
results.brief_description: John Hargreaves stars as Martin Stang, a character based on a real-life bank robber and conman, in this Australian “crime caper” film. Martin attempts to ease the burden of his time in a New South Wales jail by pretending to be blind. While he succeeds in fooling the authorities into giving him special treatment, unexpected complications arise when Martin meets Sarah, (Judy Davis) the wife of a local lay preacher, and becomes emotionally involved. The stellar Australian cast also includes Wendy Hughes, Colin Friels, Max Cullen, Michael Caton and Geoffrey Rush in his first film role. Judy Davis won the 1981 AFI Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her performance.

results.title: Meet me in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Roy Rowland, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: While vacationing in Las Vegas with his mother, a wealthy Nevada rancher meets a ballet dancer who brings him luck at the roulette wheel. Shot on location in the renowned Sands Hotel, the film captures the glitz and glamour of the neon-lit gamblers’ paradise in its martini-era prime and features numerous cameo appearances by famous actors and Las Vegas entertainers including Frank Sinatra, Paul Henreid, Lena Horne, Frankie Laine and Peter Lorre. A song and dance highlight, featuring Cyd Charisse, is the thirteen minute bop parody of the ballad ‘Frankie and Johnny’ with special lyrics by Sammy Cahn sung by Sammy Davis Jr. Other songs include ‘The Gal With The Yaller Shoes’, ‘If You Can’t Dream’, ‘My Lucky Charm’, ‘Hell Hath No Fury’, ‘I Refuse To Rock ‘N Roll’

results.title: The Man who came to dinner
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: While on a lecture tour an acid-tongued celebrity (Whiteside) and his secretary accept a dinner invitation from the Stanleys. Unfortunately on arriving at the Stanley’s home, Whiteside slips on the ice and breaks his hip subsequently finding himself confined to the Stanley’s home. During his recuperation Whiteside manages to cause chaos and mayhem with his interfering and upsetting comments. Based on the Broadway hit by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart, and adapted for the screen by Julius and Philip Epstein. Cast includes Bette Davis, Ann Sheridan, Monty Woolley, Jimmy Durante, Billie Burke, Reginald Gardiner.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on the operetta by Franz Lehar, libretto by Victor Leon and Leo Stein, this film adaptation stars Lana Turner as the “merry widow” supported by Thomas Gomez as the King of Marshovia and Fernando Lamas as the young Count Danilo. Oscar nominated for Best Art Direction/Set Decoration and Best Costumes. Cast also includes Una Merkel, Richard Haydn.

results.title: The Unfinished Dance
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Aspirational young ballet dancer refuses to let anything or anyone get in her way to becoming a prima ballerina. Cast includes Margaret O’Brien, Cyd Charisse, Karin Booth, Esther Dale, Thurston hall, harry hayden, Danny Thomas.

results.title: The Wings of eagles
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Charles Schnee and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The story is based on the life of Spig Wead, a pioneer aviator, renowned screenwriter. He scripted two of Ford’s films and was a personal friend. Spig is unable to combine his career and marriage. The exuberance of the early scenes of inter-service rivalry and the pursuit of glory rings hollow in what is basically an unattractive portrait of military life. Following the breakdown of his marriage and a crippling accident, Wead is overtaken by a profound sense of failure and loss. Cast includes John Wayne, Dan Dailey, Maureen O’Hara, Ward Bond.

results.title: Northwest passage
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, Hunt Stromberg, Loew's Inc and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An American historical drama about a group of settlers known as Rogers’ Rangers - led by Major Rogers (Spencer Tracy) - and the hardships of survival and battles with hostile Indians, they encounter in trying to settle the upper New York state area for their families in the late 1750s and early 1760s. Based on the novel “Roger’s rangers” by Kenneth Roberts. Cast includes Robert Young, Walter Brennan. Ruth Hussey.

results.title: Bathing beauty
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A romantic musical comedy set in a girls college, mainly around the swimming pool, where the beautiful Esther Williams plays the role of a swimming instructor and Red Skelton stars as her lovesick, abandoned husband. A perfect setting for some stunning choreographed underwater performances by Esther Williams. Cast also includes Basil Rathbone, Bill Goodwin, Xavier Cugat, Ethel Smith, and featuring Harry James and his Orchestra.

results.title: Designing woman
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An easy-going, unpolished sportswriter and a sophisticated clothing designer meet, fall in love and marry while both are visiting California. When they return to their homes in New York, they decide to live in her plush apartment, and their differences soon emerge. Cast includes Gregory Peck, Lauren Bacall, Dolores Gray, Sam levene. Music by Andre Previn, choreography by Jack Cole.

results.title: Nancy goes to Rio
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Talented actress and dancer Nancy Barklay is vying for a lead role in this Broadway musical set in Brazil. Unfortunately her mother is competing for the same part. The situation becomes intolerable when Nancy follows her mother to Rio in order to wrest the part off her; complications ensue when both women fall for the same man. A featherweight musical filmed in Technicolor, ‘Nancy Goes to Rio’ is mostly remembered for being Carmen Miranda’s second to last picture. The film is essentially a remake of ‘It’s A Date’, Universal, 1940. Songs include ‘Ca-Room Pa-Pa’, ‘Love Is Like This’, ‘Yipsee I-O’, ‘Time And Time Again’, ‘Nancy Goes To Rio’, ‘Shine On’, ‘Harvest Moon’, ‘Magic Is The Moonlight’, ‘Musetta’s Waltz’ and ‘Embraceable You’. Cast includes Ann Sothern, Jane Powell, Barry Sullivan, Carmen Miranda, Louis Calhern.
